intro: Fedia platyloba, commonly known as the flat-lobed fedia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy and have a broad, flat shape. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and are typically borne on short pedicels. Fedia platyloba is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky outcrops.
